items.summary: JOHANNESBURG, Jan. 19 (Xinhua) -- Nine children were injured on Monday afternoon after a vehicle lost control and crashed into a tree in Pinetown, South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal Province, local media reported. Read full story

items.title: Germany to reintroduce EV subsidies for private buyers
items.summary: BERLIN, Jan. 19 (Xinhua) -- Germany will reintroduce subsidies for private consumers purchasing electric vehicles, the environment ministry announced on Monday, reviving incentives that were halted at the end of 2023. Read full story

items.title: Russia's budget deficit around 2.6 pct of GDP in 2025: finance ministry
items.summary: MOSCOW, Jan. 19 (Xinhua) -- Russia's federal budget recorded a deficit of 5.65 trillion rubles (about 72.1 billion U.S. dollars), or around 2.6 percent of GDP, in 2025, the Russian Finance Ministry said Monday. Read full story

items.title: Bulgaria's President Radev resigns amid speculation he will form his own party
items.summary: SOFIA, Jan 19 (Reuters) - Bulgaria's ‌President Rumen Radev will resign, he said in a ‌speech on Monday, stoking widespread speculation that he will ‌form his own political party to run in upcoming parliamentary elections after the previous government resigned last month.  Read full story

items.title: Top US Catholic cardinals question morality of American foreign policy
items.summary: Jan 19 (Reuters) - ‌Three U.S. Catholic archbishops on Monday decried the direction of ‌American foreign policy, saying the country's "moral role in confronting ‌evil around the world" was in question and that military action must only be used as an extreme last resort. Read full story

items.title: Death toll from rainfall-induced incidents in Zimbabwe reaches 78
items.summary: HARARE, Jan. 19 (Xinhua) -- At least 78 people have been killed and 61 others injured as a result of incessant rains across Zimbabwe since the start of the rainy season in October, the country's Department of Civil Protection (DCP) said on Monday. Read full story

items.title: Just $20 gets you this Anker 8-in-1 Pop-Up USB-C Power strip today
items.summary:
Anker 8-in-1 USB-C Power Strip

Buy for $20 (Reg. $26)

What we love

Unlike most power strips that are chunky and awkward to place, this one keeps things slim at just 0.7 inches thick. It uses a clever pop-up outlet design, so the sockets extend only when you need them and sit flush when they’re not in use. You also get a solid mix of ports here in addition to four AC outlets – two USB-A, and two USB-C ports for everyday devices.

items.title: EcoFlow’s 3,072Wh DELTA 3 Ultra Plus power station is down at its second-best $1,399 rate, more from $408
items.summary:
As part of EcoFlow’s ongoing Disaster Winter Storm Sale that is continuing many of the previous December holiday savings, with some notable price drops and new lows, you can find the DELTA 3 Ultra Plus Portable Power Station down at $1,399 shipped, after an additional $100 is taken off automatically in your cart and can’t be stacked with the sale’s extra savings code, beating its Amazon pricing by $100. This newer unit carries a $2,899 MSRP since hitting the market at the end of September, but has been spending a considerable amount of time down at $1,499, with occasional spikes up to its full price and one-time falls lower to $1,424 during Black Friday/Cyber Monday and the $1,359 low from a New Year flash sale. With the bonus savings you’re scoring the next-best deal we have tracked behind that flash offer, cutting $1,500 off the full rate for the second-lowest price we have tracked. Head below to also browse the roundup of DELTA 3 series power station deals during this event.
